title: Standalone download link is not a real link...
body:
The download link for "Build Tools for Visual Studio 2017" on https://www.visualstudio.com/downloads/#build-tools-for-visual-studio-2017 isn't a real link, its some weird `blob` link: `blob:https://www.visualstudio.com/d0c0b53b-9358-449e-ac2e-f4dd0782f590`. This makes it hard to download from an automated script.

(I would have used the chocolatey package, but that only has 2015 in it).

Can you please look into it?

nodes.body:
Ahh. The issue sits there for nearly 3 years with no response, and then gets closed without a response.

Can you at least provide some info?

@matt-richardson The site you link to no longer has the behavior you described; it now has a link to https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/thank-you-downloading-visual-studio/?sku=BuildTools&rel=16

You may wish to see the docs the VS setup team provides: https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/install/create-a-network-installation-of-visual-studio
